---
title: Introduction
---


:::{#b94a2f5c .cell .markdown}

This is a booooook created from markdown and executable code.

See [@knuth84] and @knuth84 for additional discussion of literate programming.

Regular markdown and $E=mc^2$ equations.

\begin{align}
a &= b + c \\
d &= e * f
\end{align}

## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

:::

::: {#5b63f61d .cell execution_count=1}
``` {}
1 + 1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=1}
```
2
```
:::
:::


:::{#92a821ac .cell .markdown}
You can add options to executable code like this
:::

::: {#18c791a6 .cell execution_count=2}
``` {}
#| echo: false
2 * 2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=2}
```
4
```
:::
:::


:::{#71b0fd01 .cell .markdown}
The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).
:::

::: {#32be428a .cell execution_count=3}
``` {}
1 + 1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=3}
```
2
```
:::
:::


:::{#dc927768 .cell .markdown}
More markdown.
